opened_prs.title: feat: folder restructuration
opened_prs.body: Simple PR to improve the current organizations of the docs

opened_prs.title: Add interop framework
opened_prs.body: Documenting some of the design choices that have come up, and giving them names so we can discuss and decide.

opened_prs.title: feat: add 7683 + intents framework discussion doc
opened_prs.body: Adding a discussion doc around the goals of the open intents framework and discussion around how generalizable 7683 is across impls.

opened_prs.title: docs: message-passing groups current goals and status
opened_prs.body: This PR adds a doc page formalizing the Message Passing Working Group goals and progress.  This will be the living doc the group references for all decisions made by the group.

closed_prs.title: Docs: interoperable addresses explainer
closed_prs.body: Ideally we should publish this as a blog post somewhere for further reach. Feedback wanted!

closed_prs.title: Feat: Create chain-specific addresses user stories
closed_prs.body:
This PR includes a document that outlines the expected user stories as a goal/reference for working towards chain-specific addresses.

Resolves https://github.com/ethereum/L2-interop/issues/21

closed_prs.title: Interoperable address spec
closed_prs.body:
I believe this is at a state where we can start a discussion. It is by no means final.

While resolver with id 3 is a good stopgap solution in my opinion, I believe we should iterate on this to:
- define another interface which uses CAIP-10 addresses in the short term, and a resolver using it
- define another resolver which resorts to something like ERC-7785 for chain identification in the longer term, to do away with the usage of centralized lists.

There are several lower-level items where I would greatly appreciate your ideas and feedback, see my own comments in the diff

closed_prs.title: Feat: add chain-specific addresses properties
closed_prs.body:
This is the first PR that serves as a conversation starter to discuss properties for chain-specific addresses.

Address #19 too

closed_issues.title: Create corresponding user stories based on the insights.
[Task] Chain-Specific Addresses
closed_issues.body:
## Overview
Track the full process for "Chain-Specific Addresses" from initial research to finalizing the ERC. This includes gathering and comparing current efforts, digesting feedback, creating user stories, and ultimately drafting and finalizing the ERC.

## Objectives
- [x] #19 
- [ ] #20 
- [x] #21 
- [x] #22 
- [ ] #23 

## Details
- **Background:**  
  Chain-specific addresses are critical for interoperability. We need to consolidate existing efforts, analyze them, and ensure community feedback informs the requirements and user stories.
  
- **Requirements:**  
  - Research and compile current efforts on chain-specific addresses.
  - Organize a review session to digest findings and gather feedback.
  - Develop detailed user stories that capture the desired functionality and outcomes.
  - Draft an ERC based on these insights.
  - Iterate the draft ERC based on further feedback until a final version is agreed upon.

- **Acceptance Criteria:**  
  - Comprehensive documentation of current efforts and comparison is available.
  - Community feedback is documented and reflected in user stories.
  - A draft ERC is published for review.
  - A final ERC is approved and merged.

## Dependencies
- Coordination with team and community.
- Access to data and reports on current chain-specific address efforts.
- Review availability and proactive feedback loops.

## Additional Notes
- Ensure all documentation is maintained in the repository for transparency.
- Use standard templates and formats to ensure consistency.
- Regular updates and clear communication will be essential throughout this process.

closed_issues.title: [Task] Define properties

milestone.title: Interop demo
milestone.description: Live working MVP demo consisting of both smart-contracts and a UI showcasing the community-agreed Interop standards.

closed_issues.body:
## Overview
Define the core primitives, properties, constraints, and goals of the system as a whole. This document will form the foundation for all subsequent docs and specs, acknowledging that these properties are dynamic and may evolve over time.

## Objectives
- [ ] Define core primitives, invariants and properties.
- [ ] Define key constraints.
- [ ] Define holistic system goals.
- [ ] Reach initial consensus among all participants.

## Details
- **Background:** Before diving into detailed documentation and specifications, it's critical to agree on the underlying components that will drive the interrop efforts. This consensus ensures all teams are aligned on what the system is, its capabilities, and its limitations.
- **Requirements:** 
  - Develop a markdown document capturing the core primitives, properties, constraints, and goals.
  - Include sections that highlight the rationale behind each element.
  - Ensure the document is open for discussion and iterative updates.
- **Acceptance Criteria:** 
  - Document is complete and accessible.
  - Teams have reviewed and provided feedback.
  - A consensus has been reached, as evidenced by approvals or sign-offs in the documentation review process.

## Dependencies
- Coordination with teams and key stakeholders.
- Review of any existing documentation that may inform the definitions.

## Deliverables
- A markdown document outlining the system's core primitives, properties, constraints, and goals.
- A summary of feedback and agreed-upon changes from the review sessions.

## Additional Notes
- Remember, the properties are not fixed; this document serves as a living record that will be updated as the system evolves.
- Maintain clarity and ensure that the language used is accessible to all contributors.

wartime_milady_ceo_summary: - **Interoperable Address Specification and Discussion**: PR #14 introduces a draft specification for interoperable addresses, aiming to foster discussion on defining interfaces using CAIP-10 addresses and exploring resolver options like ERC-7785 for decentralized chain identification.

- **Chain-Specific Address Features and User Stories**: PR #25 and PR #11 focus on chain-specific addresses, with PR #25 documenting user stories as a reference for development, and PR #11 initiating a conversation on the properties and features needed for chain-specific addresses.
- **Documentation and Outreach**: PR #28 contributes an explainer on interoperable addresses, suggesting its publication as a blog post to enhance community engagement and gather broader feedback.
